programme.title: The Call Up
programme.desc: Premiere. Several gamers each receive a mysterious invitation offering them the chance to test drive the latest technology. They visit a facility where they are given the opportunity to play a hi-tech virtual reality combat game - but soon realise the conflict they are involved in is no simulation. Sci-fi adventure, starring Max Deacon and Christopher Obi(n)

programme.title: The Girl with All the Gifts
programme.desc: A scientist and a teacher living in a dystopian future embark on a journey of survival with a young girl named Melanie. Horror thriller, starring Gemma Arterton, Paddy Considine, Glenn Close and Sennia Nanua(n)

programme.title: Inferno
programme.desc: Premiere. Robert Langdon awakes with amnesia in an Italian hospital, and is soon on the run with a beautiful doctor. Racing to stop a devastating virus, the Da Vinci Code expert suffers shocking visions as an assassin closes in. Thriller, starring Tom Hanks, Felicity Jones and Irrfan Khan(n)

programme.title: Inferno: Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the mystery thriller, which once again stars Tom Hanks as Dan Brown's crusading symbologist Robert Langdon, in the second sequel to The Da Vinci Code(n)

programme.title: Frankie & Alice
programme.desc: Premiere. A black dancer develops multiple personality disorder, with one of her alter egos an angry white racist from the Deep South. With the help of a psychiatrist, she delves into her past in the hope of identifying the childhood trauma that has caused her condition. Fact-based drama, starring Halle Berry and Stellan Skarsgard(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: Premiere. A corporate risk-management consultant decides whether or not to destroy an artificially created humanoid. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kate Mara, Anya Taylor-Joy and Rose Leslie(n)

programme.title: Mr Right
programme.desc: Premiere. A woman falls for what she thinks is an ideal guy, but he turns out to be a hitman on the run from the crime cartels who employ him. Action comedy, starring Anna Kendrick, Sam Rockwell and Tim Roth(n)

programme.title: The Girl with All the Gifts

programme.title: Dog Eat Dog
programme.desc: Premiere. A crew of former prisoners are hired by a Cleveland crime syndicate to kidnap the baby of a rival mobster. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Willem Dafoe and Christopher Matthew Cook(n)

programme.title: Miles
programme.desc: Premiere. A teenage lad is desperate to move to Chicago and joins the volleyball team to get a scholarship. The problem is his high school only has a girls squad. Comedy drama, starring Missi Pyle, Stephen Root and Paul Reiser(n)

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: Premiere. A founding member of a secret society of assassins struggles to cope, as memories of his past misdeeds cause panic attacks and his family starts to fall apart. When he breaks down during the torture of a captive, his employers fear he is no longer reliable - and threaten the lives of his wife and daughter. Action thriller, starring Craig Fairbrass and James Cosmo(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming: Special
programme.desc: The making of the new Marvel superhero movie, which sees Tom Holland as the friendly neighbourhood Spider-Man, taking on Michael Keaton's Vulture with the help of Iron Man(n)

programme.title: I'll See You in My Dreams
programme.desc: A retired widow leads a quiet life, but when her dog dies, she finds herself feeling unfulfilled, and decides she needs to broaden her horizons with fresh experiences. She strikes up a friendship with a handyman, and reluctantly attends a speed dating event, where she becomes open to the possibility of a new romance. Comedy drama, starring Blythe Danner, Martin Starr, Sam Elliott and Malin Akerman(n)

programme.title: The Here After
programme.desc: Premiere. A teenager is released from a young offenders' institution and returns to his family home. He is forced to endure a life of silent misery as his past crimes inspire bullying from his schoolfriends, while their suspicious parents take steps to drive him from the community altogether. His only solace comes in a friendship with a girl who is fascinated by his dark past. Drama, starring Ulrik Munther and Mats Blomgren. In Swedish(n)

programme.title: Frankie & Alice
programme.desc: Premiere. A black dancer develops multiple personality disorder, with one of her alter egos an angry white racist from the Deep South. With the help of a psychiatrist, she delves into her past in the hope of identifying the childhood trauma that has caused her condition. Fact-based drama, starring Halle Berry and Stellan Skarsgard(n)

programme.title: Aladdin and the King of Thieves
programme.desc: The Arabian adventurer prepares to marry his beloved Jasmine, but gets distracted by a gang of robbers who have stolen a powerful magical artefact, as well as the news that his long-lost father is still alive. Animated adventure sequel, with the voice of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger, Linda Larkin and John Rhys-Davies(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
programme.desc: The son of the canine couple leaves home to join a pack of rough-and-ready strays, but he soon discovers the grass is not always greener on the other side. Animated sequel, with the voices of Scott Wolf, Alyssa Milano, Jodi Benson and Jeff Bennett(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole(n)

programme.title: The Great Mouse Detective
programme.desc: The evil Professor Ratigan masterminds a cunning plan to become supreme ruler of all mousedom by kidnapping a clever toy-maker and forcing him to participate in his evil schemes - but super-sleuth Basil of Baker Street is soon on the case. Animated adventure, with the voices of Vincent Price, Barrie Ingham, Val Bettin and Alan Young(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson(n)

programme.title: Lilo & Stitch
programme.desc: A manic, mischievous alien escapes from the galactic police and crash-lands his spaceship on Hawaii. A lonely little girl mistakes the stranded creature for a dog and adopts him - but alien and Earth authorities are soon combing the island in search of him. Disney animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Daveigh Chase, Chris Sanders, Tia Carrere, Ving Rhames and David Ogden Stiers(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush(n)

programme.title: Jungle 2 Jungle
programme.desc: A businessman ventures deep into the Amazon to look for his estranged doctor wife seeking a divorce, only to discover he has a 13-year-old son who has been raised as part of a jungle tribe. The boy is sent back to New York with his father, but has a lot to learn about the modern world. Comedy, starring Tim Allen, Lolita Davidovich, Martin Short, JoBeth Williams and Sam Huntington(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecked
programme.desc: A youngster joins a sailing ship to raise money to save his parents' farm, but soon finds himself mixed up in adventure after being thrown overboard and washed up on an island inhabited by a gang of pirates. Disney adventure, starring Gabriel Byrne, Stian Smestad and Louisa Haigh(n)

programme.title: White Fang 2: The Myth of the White Wolf
programme.desc: A white boy races to the aid of Native Americans with the help of his fearless hound, in a bid to prevent their sacred tribal ground being taken over by miners. Adventure sequel set during the Alaskan Gold Rush, and inspired by Jack London's novel, starring Scott Bairstow, Alfred Molina, Charmaine Craig and Geoffrey Lewis(n)

programme.title: Underdog
programme.desc: A mad scientist kidnaps a beagle to use as a guinea pig in his deranged experiments. But an accidental injection leaves the mutt with awe-inspiring superpowers, which he uses to foil the deranged inventor's plans to take over a city. Comedy adventure, starring Peter Dinklage and James Belushi, and featuring the voices of Jason Lee and Amy Adams(n)

programme.title: A Goofy Movie
programme.desc: The Disney cartoon dog takes his son on an old-fashioned fishing trip in an attempt to bond with the lad. However, young Max has boasted to his pals that he is going to a pop concert in Los Angeles, and has a few ideas on how to trick his dopey dad. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Bill Farmer, Jason Marsden and Wallace Shawn(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly(n)

programme.title: Aladdin
programme.desc: A street urchin is caught up in a scheming grand vizier's plot to get his clutches on a magical lamp. Retrieving the object from a wondrous cave, he releases a powerful genie trapped inside, whose ability to grant wishes helps the young hero thwart the villain's plans and woo a princess. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger and Linda Larkin(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: An Antarctic scientific expedition has to be aborted when a blizzard hits, forcing their guide to leave behind his team of huskies in the frozen wilderness. He is determined to return and rescue the animals, but in the meantime, the dogs have to rely on pack instinct alone to ensure their survival in the hostile climate. Disney adventure, starring Paul Walker, Bruce Greenwood and Jason Biggs(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp(n)

programme.title: Bambi
programme.desc: A young deer grows up in the forest, forming close friendships with other woodland creatures. When tragedy strikes, he is suddenly forced to fend for himself but ultimately becomes brave and resourceful enough to save his friends during a forest fire. Animated drama, with the voices of Bobby Stewart, Hardie Albright and Donnie Dunagan(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly(n)

programme.title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
programme.desc: A Victorian scientist investigating the mysterious sinking of whaling ships in the Pacific falls overboard during an attack on his vessel. Along with a veteran mariner and a diver, he is picked up and taken captive by Captain Nemo and whisked away on a series of adventures in his futuristic submarine. Disney fantasy, based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Kirk Douglas, James Mason, Paul Lukas and Peter Lorre(n)

programme.title: The Watcher in the Woods
programme.desc: Two sisters are haunted by a ghost when they and their American family move into an old mansion set deep in an English forest. As the spirit makes more and more contact with them, the girls come to realise that the spirit is the ghost of the owner's child who went missing long ago. Thriller, starring Bette Davis, Carroll Baker, David McCallum and Lynn-Holly Johnson(n)

programme.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
programme.desc: A science student creates an invisibility spray, an invention that could help save his college from financial ruin - but it soon attracts the attention of a gang of scheming crooks wanting to use it for more dishonest ends. Disney adventure, sequel to The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes, starring Kurt Russell, Cesar Romero, Joe Flynn and Jim Backus(n)

programme.title: Benji the Hunted
programme.desc: Talented mongrel Benji is separated from his trainer in a shipwreck and ends up stranded in the Canadian wilderness - where he becomes foster father to a litter of orphaned cougar cubs. However, a hungry timber wolf is also prowling in the area, and looks set to clash with the courageous dog. Disney adventure, starring Red Steagall, Frank Inn and Nancy Francis(n)

programme.title: The Gnome-Mobile
programme.desc: An eccentric millionaire, along with his niece and nephew, finds two gnomes whose homes have been destroyed. They decide to help them find the rest of the tribe, but the family's friends think the tiny creatures are a figment of their imagination. Children's fantasy, starring Walter Brennan, Matthew Garber and Karen Dotrice(n)

programme.title: Aladdin and the King of Thieves
programme.desc: The Arabian adventurer prepares to marry his beloved Jasmine, but gets distracted by a gang of robbers who have stolen a powerful magical artefact, as well as the news that his long-lost father is still alive. Animated adventure sequel, with the voice of Robin Williams, Scott Weinger, Linda Larkin and John Rhys-Davies(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson(n)

programme.title: Sanjay's Super Team
programme.desc: Bored with his father's meditation, a young Indian boy daydreams of Hindu gods as superheroes. Animated short, with the voices of Brent Schraff, Sunny Singh Attar, Arun Rao and Jaquelynn Herrera(n)

programme.title: Tarzan
programme.desc: A man raised by gorillas in the jungle has his first encounter with humans in the form of a scientist and his daughter, and is torn between remaining among the apes or rediscovering his roots. He must also fight to defend his animal friends from a big-game hunter. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tony Goldwyn and Minnie Driver(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Game Ever Played
programme.desc: A single-minded American golfer's determination helps him to overcome the sport's class prejudice against his working-class background and his father's cynicism for the chance to test his skills against his idol in the 1913 US Open. Fact-based drama directed by Bill Paxton, starring Shia LaBeouf, Stephen Dillane, Elias Koteas and Josh Flitter(n)

programme.title: Invincible
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck barman is having a hard time coping after his wife leaves him and he loses his teaching job. His fortunes turn around when the American football team he has supported all his life holds open trials and, against all odds, he wins a place on the squad. Fact-based sporting drama, starring Mark Wahlberg, Greg Kinnear and Elizabeth Banks(n)

programme.title: Man of the House
programme.desc: A youngster is doing his best to make life hell for his potential stepfather and sabotaging all his plans to marry his mother, when a series of unforeseen events brings the pair closer together. Disney comedy, starring Chevy Chase, Farrah Fawcett, Jonathan Taylor Thomas and George Wendt(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan(n)

programme.title: Strange Magic
programme.desc: A fairy living in an enchanted forest tries to rescue her sister from a monstrous creature. Meanwhile, the magical kingdom is thrown into chaos by a love potion, that results in a series of unexpected romances. Animated fantasy musical, with the voices of Evan Rachel Wood, Alan Cumming and Kristin Chenoweth(n)

programme.title: Matilda
programme.desc: A gifted youngster is packed off by her selfish parents to the prison-like Crunchem Hall School. Once there, she befriends a sweet-natured teacher who convinces her that not all grown-ups are bad - and urges her to use her special powers to turn the tables on the nasty headmistress. Fantasy comedy, adapted from the children's book by Roald Dahl, with Mara Wilson, Pam Ferris, Embeth Davidtz, Rhea Perlman and Danny DeVito, who also directed(n)

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Lightning Thief
programme.desc: A teenager is shocked to discover he is the son of Greek god Poseidon and has been accused of stealing Zeus's lightning bolt. The youngster is given 14 days to find the culprit and return the missing item before the furious deity instigates an apocalyptic war. Fantasy adventure, starring Logan Lerman, Pierce Brosnan, Brandon T Jackson, Alexandra Daddario, Jake Abel, Sean Bean and Steve Coogan(n)

programme.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
programme.desc: Eccentric inventor Caractacus Potts rescues an old car from the scrapheap, only to discover it has magical, gravity-defying powers. Meanwhile, Baron Bomburst, the blundering ruler of Vulgaria, will do anything to get his greedy hands on it. Children's musical adventure, based on the book by Ian Fleming, starring Dick Van Dyke, Lionel Jeffries, Sally Ann Howes, Gert Frobe, Benny Hill and James Robertson Justice(n)

programme.title: Strange Magic
programme.desc: A fairy living in an enchanted forest tries to rescue her sister from a monstrous creature. Meanwhile, the magical kingdom is thrown into chaos by a love potion, that results in a series of unexpected romances. Animated fantasy musical, with the voices of Evan Rachel Wood, Alan Cumming and Kristin Chenoweth(n)

programme.title: Matilda
programme.desc: A gifted youngster is packed off by her selfish parents to the prison-like Crunchem Hall School. Once there, she befriends a sweet-natured teacher who convinces her that not all grown-ups are bad - and urges her to use her special powers to turn the tables on the nasty headmistress. Fantasy comedy, adapted from the children's book by Roald Dahl, with Mara Wilson, Pam Ferris, Embeth Davidtz, Rhea Perlman and Danny DeVito, who also directed(n)

programme.title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
programme.desc: A feisty foster kid comes up with an outlandish scheme to be reunited with her birth mum. Coming-of-age drama, starring Kathy Bates, Glenn Close and Sophie Nelisse(n)

programme.title: The Cat from Outer Space
programme.desc: A UFO crash-lands on Earth and its only occupant is an alien cat whose collar gives him strange powers, including the ability to communicate telepathically with humans. This turns out to be a useful skill when he is forced to enlist help to get his spaceship back after the US government seizes it. Disney sci-fi comedy, with Roddy McDowall and Sandy Duncan(n)

programme.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
programme.desc: Eccentric inventor Caractacus Potts rescues an old car from the scrapheap, only to discover it has magical, gravity-defying powers. Meanwhile, Baron Bomburst, the blundering ruler of Vulgaria, will do anything to get his greedy hands on it. Children's musical adventure, based on the book by Ian Fleming, starring Dick Van Dyke, Lionel Jeffries, Sally Ann Howes, Gert Frobe, Benny Hill and James Robertson Justice(n)

programme.title: Man of the House
programme.desc: A youngster is doing his best to make life hell for his potential stepfather and sabotaging all his plans to marry his mother, when a series of unforeseen events brings the pair closer together. Disney comedy, starring Chevy Chase, Farrah Fawcett, Jonathan Taylor Thomas and George Wendt(n)

programme.title: Teacher's Pet
programme.desc: A family remain unaware their dog is super-intelligent, and able to read and speak. The canine genius disguises himself as a boy so he can go to school and longs to be a real human. He seeks out a mad scientist who claims to be able to turn animals into people, but he soon learns that being human is not all fun. Animated adventure, with the voices of Nathan Lane and Kelsey Grammer(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
programme.desc: A youngster is forced to stage his own death to escape his cruel father, and embarks on a series of adventures accompanied by a runaway slave in 19th-century Mississippi. Disney adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale, starring Elijah Wood, Courtney B Vance, Robbie Coltrane, Jason Robards, Dana Ivey, Anne Heche and Ron Perlman(n)

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell(n)

programme.title: Rabbit School: Guardians Of The Golden Egg
programme.desc: When the Easter rabbit school comes under threat from a family of foxes plotting to steal the legendary golden egg, it's up to young Max to save the day. Animated adventure, featuring the voice of Noah Levi and Senta Berger(n)

programme.title: Throne of Elves
programme.desc: In the mythical realm of Altera, young hero Lambert is drawn into a bitter conflict between elf princess Liya and her malevolent rival, Elena. Epic animated fantasy, featuring the voices of Ashley Boettcher and GK Bowes(n)

programme.title: Pan
programme.desc: A 12-year-old orphan is abducted and taken away to a magical land by a band of pirates, who need child labour to mine a magical substance created by fairies. He escapes, joining forces with a roguish adventurer, and goes in search of the truth about his mother and his own destiny. Fantasy adventure prequel to Peter Pan, starring Levi Miller, Hugh Jackman, Garrett Hedlund and Rooney Mara(n)

programme.title: Barnyard

programme.desc: A youngster is forced to stage his own death to escape his cruel father, and embarks on a series of adventures accompanied by a runaway slave in 19th-century Mississippi. Disney adaptation of Mark Twain's classic tale, starring Elijah Wood, Courtney B Vance, Robbie Coltrane, Jason Robards, Dana Ivey, Anne Heche and Ron Perlman(n)

programme.title: The Big Green
programme.desc: An English teacher provides her American pupils with an introduction to the joys of soccer, giving them the pride and ability to take on the best at the state championships, and winning the heart of the local sheriff along the way. Sporting comedy, starring Steve Guttenberg, Olivia d'Abo and Jay O Sanders(n)

programme.title: Dennis
programme.desc: A well-meaning little boy with an inability to stay out of trouble is the bane of his curmudgeonly neighbour, Mr Wilson. But when a thief steals Wilson's coin collection, the tiny terror seizes the chance to make amends and come to the rescue. Slapstick comedy based on the comic strip, starring Walter Matthau, Mason Gamble, Joan Plowright, Christopher Lloyd and Lea Thompson(n)

programme.title: DuckTales the Movie: Treasure of the Lost Lamp
programme.desc: Scrooge McDuck and great-nephews Huey, Dewey and Louie lead an archaeological expedition to find a long-lost genie's lamp once belonging to a notorious bandit, but reckon without a villainous attempt to use its powers in a dastardly plot. Animated Disney adventure, with the voices of Christopher Lloyd, Alan Young and Russi Taylor(n)

programme.title: Paulie
programme.desc: An intelligent parrot falls into late-night conversation with a janitor and ends up recounting the tale of his epic cross-country journey in search of a new life - a plan that went awry when an evil scientist managed to get his hands on the brilliant bird for his own nefarious ends. Family adventure, starring Gena Rowlands, Tony Shalhoub, Cheech Marin, Bruce Davison and the voice of Jay Mohr(n)

programme.title: Race to Witch Mountain
programme.desc: An ex-convict cab driver becomes the protector of two aliens disguised as children who claim to hold the key to Earth's continued existence. As he races against time to return the visitors to their spaceship, he must also hold off hostile government agents and a sinister extraterrestrial assassin. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. He is promptly mistaken for an English upper-class cat, who has recently inherited a grand estate, and moves into his stately home - much to the dismay of the real aristocratic feline's conniving relation, who is bent on swindling him out of his money. Family comedy, starring Breckin Meyer, Billy Connolly and Jennifer Love Hewitt, with the voices of Bill Murray and Tim Curry(n)

programme.title: An Eskimo Tale
programme.desc: When animals start mysteriously disappearing, three young Inuits embark on a perilous journey to save their tribe from ruin. Animated adventure, with the voice of Christopher Plummer(n)

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Road Chip
programme.desc: The singing rodents mistakenly come to the conclusion that their human friend Dave intends to get rid of them when he proposes to his girlfriend in Miami. With only three days until Dave pops the question, the trio embark on a desperate road trip across America to sabotage his romantic plans. Family comedy sequel, starring Jason Lee and Kimberly Williams-Paisley(n)

programme.title: Horton Hears a Who
programme.desc: A kindly elephant hears a cry of help coming from a speck of dust and discovers the minuscule city of Whoville. As he tries to help its citizens, the other animals begin to question his sanity, and the evil Kangaroo incites them to turn against the do-gooder. Animated adaptation of Dr Seuss's book, with the voices of Jim Carrey, Steve Carell, Carol Burnett, Seth Rogen and Will Arnett(n)

programme.title: Treasure Buddies
programme.desc: Five golden retriever puppies embark on a danger-filled quest halfway across the world as they search for the greatest treasure known to animalkind. Arriving in Egypt, the canine explorers make some new exotic friends and search through ancient ruins as they try to stop devious sphynx cat Ubasti from claiming their prize. Family adventure sequel, with the voices of Skyler Gisondo and Elaine Hendrix(n)

programme.title: Garfield: A Tale of Two Kitties
programme.desc: The lazy moggy stows away in his owner's luggage and ends up in London. Sci-fi adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, AnnaSophia Robb, Alexander Ludwig and Carla Gugino(n)

programme.title: Scooby-Doo 2: Monsters Unleashed
programme.desc: The amateur detectives attend the grand opening of a museum in their honour, featuring the costumes from all the fake monsters they exposed. The exhibits are stolen by a masked villain, who sets about re-creating all the gang's worst enemies. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Sarah Michelle Gellar, Matthew Lillard, Freddie Prinze Jr and Linda Cardellini(n)

programme.title: Point Last Seen
programme.desc: The head of a search and rescue team whose children were kidnapped by her ex-husband hunts obsessively for a girl gone missing in the desert. However, her search is interrupted by news that her spouse has been found - but the children he took are nowhere to be found. Fact-based drama, starring Linda Hamilton and Kevin Kilner(n)

programme.title: Mojave
programme.desc: A suicidal artist drives into the desert seeking solitude, hoping to find some meaning in his shallow life. He meets a mysterious drifter who throws his life off course, and must find a way to conquer his depression in order to protect the things he cares about. Thriller, starring Oscar Isaac, Garrett Hedlund and Mark Wahlberg(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster(n)

programme.title: Love Me Do
programme.desc: A female investment banker lets an out-of-work actor into her life for a romantic adventure with chilling results. Drama, starring Jack Gordon, Rebecca Calder and Max Wrottesley(n)

programme.title: The Runner
programme.desc: A politician's idealistic attitude to his career is contrasted by a disastrous personal life. He is forced to rethink his priorities when a sex scandal brings his reputation into disrepute in the aftermath of a catastrophic oil spill. Drama, starring Nicolas Cage, Sarah Paulson, Connie Nielsen and Peter Fonda(n)

programme.title: The Maid's Room
programme.desc: A Colombian immigrant hired as a live-in maid at a luxurious summer house in Long Island witnesses something she shouldn't. Thriller, starring Paula Garces, Annabella Sciorra and Bill Camp(n)

programme.title: Careful What You Wish For
programme.desc: A teenager gets more than he bargained for after entering into an affair with the wife of an investment banker, as a suspicious death and substantial life insurance policy embroil him in a scandal. Thriller, starring Nick Jonas, Dermot Mulroney and Isabel Lucas(n)

programme.title: Every Secret Thing
programme.desc: When a young child goes missing, suspicion falls on two teenagers previously convicted for killing a baby. Thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks, Diane Lane and Dakota Fanning(n)

programme.title: Love Me Do
programme.desc: A female investment banker lets an out-of-work actor into her life for a romantic adventure with chilling results. Drama, starring Jack Gordon, Rebecca Calder and Max Wrottesley(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette(n)

programme.title: We Still Kill the Old Way
programme.desc: A former gangster returns to London after 30 years living in exile in Spain when he receives word of his brother's murder. Angered by the brutality of a new generation of criminals who have taken over his territory, he gets his old partners in crime back together to avenge his sibling and restore order to the streets. Gangster drama, starring Ian Ogilvy and Allison Doody(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
